meanings.definition: A person or thing that acts with great power or influence.
meanings.sent1: The superagents of the forest were the mighty bears who ruled over all other animals.
meanings.sent2: The government officials were considered superagents as they made important decisions affecting the entire country.
meanings.sent3: The superagents, the wise old owls, gathered to discuss the fate of the enchanted forest.
meanings.sent4: The CEO was a superagent, controlling the company's destiny with a firm hand.
meanings.sent5: In the world of magic, the superagents were the wizards who could bend reality to their will.

meanings.definition: A person who represents or acts on behalf of others with exceptional skill or ability.
meanings.sent1: The lawyer was a superagent in the courtroom, winning every case with ease.
meanings.sent2: The superhero was known as a superagent, always coming to the rescue when needed.
meanings.sent3: The superagents, the talented musicians, performed a concert that mesmerized the audience.
meanings.sent4: The teacher was a superagent, guiding her students to success with patience and care.
meanings.sent5: The detective was a superagent, solving the mystery in record time with his sharp mind.
